name: Kindergarten School Readiness- Deadline 2
description:
The purpose of the Kindergarten School Readiness (KSR) data collection is to provide baseline data for measuring improvement in students' knowledge and skills over time and to collect data needed to fulfill statutory requirements for an annual legislative report.

Data reported to CDE will be from the initial fall assessment window. The initial assessment is to be completed within the first 60 calendar days of the school year as required by HB 15-1323. The collection will be open from mid-October to mid-December each year.

The State Board of Education voted on March 11, 2020 to add named domains to the reporting requirements for CDE. This change is reflected in the File Layout and Definitions section below. This change does not change any requirements around the administration of the assessment.

step1.title: Test students
step1.description:
[color=rgb(51, 51, 51)]Test students using an approved assessment. The State Board of Education has tools determined to be [/color][color=rgb(64, 63, 59)][url=http://www.cde.state.co.us/early/ecassessment-faq#definitions]valid, reliable and research-based[/url][/color][color=rgb(51, 51, 51)] instruments for assessing kindergarten school readiness and informing individual readiness plans. [/color]
[color=rgb(51, 51, 51)]﻿[/color]
Who: [color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]All kindergarten students who receive 0.5 FTE funding or greater. [/color]
[color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Where: All schools that serve kindergarten students who receive 0.5 FTE or greater. This includes charter schools.[/color]
[color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]When: Students are assessed in the first 60 days of the school year. The first 60 days should align with each school’s calendar.[/color]

[color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Assess the varying skill levels and knowledge with which students enter kindergarten (C.R.S. 22-7-1002 (2)) and inform individual learning plans for each publicly funded student (C.R.S. 22-7-1014).[/color]
[ml][ul][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Physical well-being and motor development[/color][/li][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Social and emotional development[/color][/li][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Language and comprehension development[/color][/li][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Cognition[/color][/li][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Literacy[/color][/li][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Math[/color][/li][/ul][/ml]

step2.title: Extract and Organize Data
step2.description:
[color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Access the platform or assessment tool where the data is stored and export the data. This will need to be uploaded to the provided template in resources (KSR Collection File Template). Make sure every column/row contains information; otherwise, you will receive many errors once it is run through the data pipeline. Please review the KSR Collection File Layout and Data Elements (also in resources) to familiarize yourself with the appropriate coding requirements. [/color]

[color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]There are two main approaches to completing the KSR File Template: [/color]
[ml][ul][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]A) Data from one source, and it exists in a single extract: Includes all six domains.[/color][/li][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]B) Date from multiple extracts: Different domains contained in different extracts.[/color][/li][/ul][/ml][color=rgb(64, 64, 64)]Please make sure you are gathering ALL data from ALL sources if you do not utilize one platform for collecting data. [/color]

step3.title: Submit
step3.description: Upload your completed KSR file to Reportwell. The district will review your file and you will receive communication via benchmark notes. This district will let you know if there are any revisions that need to be made. If you receive confirmation that you have an error free report, you are done with this collection and you can mark the Kindergarten School Readiness- Deadline 3 benchmark complete. If you [b]receive an error report, [/b]you MUST fix those errors and resubmit in the [b]Kindergarten School Readiness- Deadline 3 benchmark[/b].

name: Kindergarten School Readiness- Deadline 3
description:
The purpose of the Kindergarten School Readiness (KSR) data collection is to provide baseline data for measuring improvement in students' knowledge and skills over time and to collect data needed to fulfill statutory requirements for an annual legislative report.

Data reported to CDE will be from the initial fall assessment window. The initial assessment is to be completed within the first 60 calendar days of the school year as required by HB 15-1323. The collection will be open from mid-October to mid-December each year.

The State Board of Education voted on March 11, 2020 to add named domains to the reporting requirements for CDE. This change is reflected in the File Layout and Definitions section below. This change does not change any requirements around the administration of the assessment.

step1.title: Download and Review Error Report
step1.description: If your school had errors, please locate the error report in the Kindergarten School Readiness- Deadline 1 note.

step2.title: Fix errors
step2.description: Go though and fix all errors that your schools report has. You MUST fix all errors before uploading again. If errors are not corrected, CDE data pipeline will not accept the file and you will receive another error report with little time to correct before the collection window closes. We cannot be late on submissions to CDE.

step3.title: Upload
step3.description: Upload your corrected errors. Communication will be sent via benchmarks notes [b]on this benchmark [/b]if there are still errors within your report.

name: SAC Training- Kick-Off - School Assessment Coordinator-Charter Schools Specialist will mark complete based on attendance
description:
Training is on September 26th from 8:00 am to 10:00 am for High School SAC's and from 10:00-12:00 for Elementary and Middle Schools SAC's.

Required training for School Assessment Coordinators. 1 assessment coordinator from each school is required. This training will give an overview of assessment for the year from CDE, District 49 requirements, overview of accommodations that should be in place for instruction now in order to be used for state assessment in the spring, and details on unique accommodation request process, due in November.

step1.title: Step 1
step1.description: Plan with your team to ensure at least one assessment coordinator from the school attends, both is ideal

step2.title: Step 2
step2.description:
Attend training at Creekside Success Center [color=var(--bbQxAb)]3850 Pony Tracks Dr, Colorado Springs, CO 80922 in Peakview Hall. [/color]

step3.title: Step 3
step3.description:
[b]D49 will mark this benchmark complete for you based on the attendance/sign in sheet.[/b]
[b]﻿[/b]
After attending the training, work with your building leader on the implementation of the requirements outlined in the training.
[ml][ul][li indent=0 align=left]Work with special education, CLDE, 504 plan managers to identify what accommodations are documented for students at the school for state assessments in the formal plans. Ensure these accommodations are in place daily, in instruction.[/li][li indent=0 align=left]Track accommodations required for assessment and document need.[/li][li indent=0 align=left]Work with special education and 504 plan managers to identify students that may qualify for a Unique Accommodation Request. These requests must be completed by Thanksgiving. These requests require a good deal of data and time to complete so start early.[/li][/ul][/ml]

name: EOY: 700 Level Warnings
description: The 700-level student end-of-year warnings will become errors in the next phase of the CDE Student End-of-Year Collection if not addressed now. This is the last phase of EOY which many data fields can be changed without additional documents required by the schools.

step1.title: Review Warnings
step1.description: These warnings, as identified by CDE, were shared in ReportWell messenger on 9/24. Please review the student details in your SIS

step2.title: Provide Updates
step2.description: Either provide a completed confirmation of enrollment and attendance by the receiving school for CDE documentation, or submit a request to have their exit code update, either as a drop out (if no adequate documentation available) or as appropriate based on the documentation received by the receiving school.

step3.title: Submit
step3.description: Submit your documentation/change request for D49 to update within the CDE data pipeline.

name: October Count - Handbook
description: The purpose of the Student October Snapshot is to determine funding for Local Education Agencies (LEAs) districts and schools by taking a count of students in attendance on the Pupil Enrollment Date (10/01/2024). step1.title: Review Handbook
step1.description:
[highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]Draft or review and update your student handbook for the year.[/highlight]
[highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]﻿[/highlight]
[highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]Save the finalized handbook with the appropriate naming convention: SchoolCode_Handbook[/highlight]

step2.title: Create Course Descriptions
step2.description:
[highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]Collect or draft descriptions for all courses in which active students are enrolled/are receiving credit.[/highlight]

[highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]Download finalized course descriptions (no naming convention). If this information is contained in your student handbook this does not need to be a separate document.[/highlight]

step3.title: Submit Documents
step3.description:
[b][highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]This additional benchmark is for schools to upload what they have in order to give the Data and Performance team time to go over your submission and look for errors and suggest edits. If you do not utilize this benchmark, please know that the team may not have enough time to review your document before the final due date to CDE.[/highlight][/b]

[highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]Upload your finalized handbook and course descriptions to Reportwell.[/highlight]

[highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]If this is not required for your school and you choose not to complete, select "There is nothing to complete for this report" and submit (indicate in the comment that this is an optional requirement for your school).[/highlight]

name: Charter School Responsibilities in State Assessments
description:
Charter Schools are considered their own LEP (Local Education Provider) for purposes of the following state laws: Paper-based testing options: §22-7-1013(6), §22-7-1006.3(1)(d-e) Assessment information for parents: §22-7-1013(7)(a) Parent excuse information: §22-7-1013(8)(a-c).

District Assessment Coordinators (DAC) are responsible for Training School Assessment Coordinators (SAC) at charter schools in the district, Communicating charter school Paper Testing (PBT) selections to CDE, Hold charter schools responsible for the inventory and return of all paper testing materials. 

From CDE: Charter Schools are responsible for - Each LEP must adopt and implement a written policy by which it decides whether to request the paper form of the state assessments for its students. Decision must be made in consultation with schools and parents copy of policy must be shared with parents and posted on LEP website LEP may make the decision by school or class (i.e., grade level and content area) LEP will report the number of students who will take the paper form.

step1.title: Considerations
step1.description:
[ml][ul][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Technology capacity[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Logistics[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Must have the grade appropriate calculators for CMAS math (grades 6-8)[/highlight][/li][/ul][/ml]
[highlight=transparent]﻿Default method of testing in District 49 is online:[/highlight]

[ml][ul][ul data=1][li indent=1 align=left][highlight=transparent]Paper testing is an option as the default method of testing for charter schools for CMAS but is not available as the default method of testing for the SAT Suite or ACCESS unless as a documented accommodation.Paper forms are available to individual students as an accommodation[/highlight][/li][li indent=1 align=left][highlight=transparent]Online form is also available as an accommodation [/highlight][/li][li indent=1 align=left][highlight=transparent]For students needing accommodations, these need to be documented in the specified platform within the communicated timelines to be reviewed by the testing agency.[/highlight][/li][/ul][/ul][/ml]

step2.title: Secure/Transportation and Assessment Calendar
step2.description:
[ml][ul][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Must commit to meeting security requirements and accounting for all secure materials[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Chain-of-custody documentation and reports for missing materials[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Charter schools must have secure storage facilities for all paper materials ordered. [/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Charter schools must pick up and transport all paper testing materials. Charter staff must commit a time investment to inventory and organize paper materials.[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]LEP will annually distribute to parents and post on its website, as early in the school year as possible, written information regarding its assessments, including:[/highlight][/li][ul data=1][li indent=1 align=left][highlight=transparent]The state and local assessments that the LEP will administer [/highlight][/li][li indent=1 align=left][highlight=transparent]Identify whether it is required by federal law, required by state law or selected by the LEP[/highlight][/li][/ul][/ul][/ml][highlight=transparent]﻿[/highlight]
[highlight=transparent]Assessment Calendar[/highlight]
[ml][ul][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Estimated hours of testing each testing day for specific classes/grades for each assessment[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]Identify whether the assessment is required by state law, federal law or locally selected[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]The purposes of the assessments[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][highlight=transparent]The manner in which assessment results will be used[/highlight][/li][li indent=0 align=left][color=rgb(17, 85, 204)][highlight=transparent][url=https://www.d49.org/our-services/learning-services/assessment]See District 49 website - for example[/url][/highlight][/color][/li][/ul][/ml]

step3.title: Complete Google Form
step3.description:
[color=rgb(0, 0, 0)][highlight=transparent]Communicate this decision to the DAC, Kathleen Granaas, through this [/highlight][/color][color=rgb(17, 85, 204)][highlight=transparent][url=https://forms.gle/NacZzjuxrtPRnoCq7]linked[/url][/highlight][/color][color=rgb(0, 0, 0)][highlight=transparent] form. [/highlight][/color][b][color=rgb(0, 0, 0)][highlight=transparent]DUE NOV 22, 2024[/highlight][/color][/b]

[color=rgb(0, 0, 0)][highlight=transparent]Reach out to [/highlight][/color][color=rgb(32, 33, 36)]Verenice Gutierrez, Rochelle Kolhouse or Kathleen Granaas[/color][color=rgb(0, 0, 0)][highlight=transparent] with questions. [/highlight][/color]

name: EOY Adequate Docs
description: Your school has CDE End of Year warnings due to their exit code not being reported as an entry code in the following district/facility. This will become an error in the next phase.

step1.title: Review Adequate Documentation
step1.description: Review the withdrawal documentation received for the students identified as EOY warnings and verify the correct exit code was used. Example: were they a CO public school (13), was it a private school (15), etc.

step2.title: Update your SIS
step2.description:
If the exit code was incorrect based on the school type of where they transferred to, update your SIS. 

If correct, download the adequate documentation received before withdrawal.

step3.title: Provide Updates to D49
step3.description:
If the exit code is correct, you will need to submit the completed adequate documentation of transfer as required by CDE for verification your coding is correct. 

If the exit code is not correct, submit the update you would like D49 to make within the pipeline.

Any student who does not have the CDE required adequate documentation of transfer, will be coded as a dropout (40 or 06).

name: READ Spring Assessment Reporting
description: Districts must annually report the information necessary to determine the prevalence of SRDs among students in grades K-3. This data determines the per-pupil funding for districts by dividing the amount of money available by the total number of K-3 students identified has having an SRD in the preceding budget year. District must also report whether or not students in grades 4-12 remain on a READ plan.

name: READ Training Reporting- Deadline 1
description: Districts must annually ensure and report that all K-3 teachers who provide literacy instruction to students in grades K-3 and all teachers who provide reading intervention in grades 4-12 have successfully completed evidence-based training in teaching reading. Districts must also report K-3 principals/administrators and/or personnel who the LEP determines meet the statute criteria as needing to complete the K-3 Principal/Administrator training. Districts must annually ensure and report that all K-3 teachers who provide literacy instruction to students in grades K-3 and all teachers who provide reading intervention in grades 4-12 have successfully completed evidence-based training in teaching reading. Districts must also report K-3 principals/administrators and/or personnel who the LEP determines meet the statute criteria as needing to complete the K-3 Principal/Administrator training. Districts must annually ensure and report that all K-3 teachers who provide literacy instruction to students in grades K-3 and all teachers who provide reading intervention in grades 4-12 have successfully completed evidence-based training in teaching reading. Districts must also report K-3 principals/administrators and/or personnel who the LEP determines meet the statute criteria as needing to complete the K-3 Principal/Administrator training.

step1.title: Review D49 Guidance
step1.description: Review guidance provided by the Coordinator of Literacy Performance (see resources). It is important to make sure staff are working through this training in a timely manner as to miss district completion deadline (this is to allow the district enough time to compile charter school data with district data in order to meet CDE deadline). This training is 45 hours (20 hours for admin) so it is imperative to give appropriate time to complete.

step2.title: Template
step2.description:
THIS BENCHMARK IS TO PROVIDE US WITH THE NAMES OF K-3 TEACHERS/K-3 ADMIN/K-3 LITERACY COACHES/K-12 SPECIAL EDUCATION TEACHERS/K-12 READING INTERVENTIONISTS NOT PROOF OF COMPLETION. PARAPROFESSIONALS ARE NOT REQUIRED TO COMPLETE THE TRAINING. (Please complete only Columns B - H at this time.  Columsn I - M will be completed in July 2025.) 

**Please note** All training must be completed by June 30, 2025**

Fill out the provided template. ONLY INCLUDE STAFF WHO HAVE NOT BEEN PREVIOUSLY REPORTED IN ANY SCHOOL YEAR PRIOR TO 2024/2025.

step3.title: Submit
step3.description: Submit template via Reportwell.

name: Discipline report- Communications- Checkpoint 1
description: The Discipline Interchange updates the Special Education Discipline Interchange file with data fields required per HB22-1376 which includes data previously collected in the periodic files for the School Discipline files (Discipline by Action, Discipline by Demographics and Firearm Data). The updated Discipline Interchange file process will start in the 2023-2024 school year and will contain one file: the Discipline Action File. In the file, all students who were disciplined during the reporting school year will be reported. This information is used in the Student Discipline Snapshot for all students and Special Education Discipline snapshot for students with an active IEP.

step1.description: This collection uses data from multiple different sources that charter schools already submit. If there is anything that we do not already have you may be asked to provide that data.

name: EDID Request (New)
description: The Educator Identification System (EDIS) assigns each educator in the state of Colorado a unique Identification Number (ID) that will follow the educator throughout their service in Colorado public education. The purpose of the educator ID is to be able to use a unique number that preserves the privacy of educator records while allowing statutorily required data analyses.

step1.title: Check for Existing EDID
step1.description: [color=rgb(0, 0, 0)]When bringing on new educators at your school, check for an existing EDID number through employee records. EDIDs are necessary for these state reports.[/color]

step2.title: Request EDID
step2.description: [color=rgb(0, 0, 0)]Fill out template and submit. **Please leave the first column blank (EDID) as this is where CDE will return the number**[/color]

step3.title: Receive EDID
step3.description: [color=rgb(0, 0, 0)]Check benchmark notes for EDID.[/color]

name: RANDA Access (COPMS)
description:
The Colorado State Model Performance Management System (COPMS) in RANDA is an optional tool to support districts in the implementation, data collection and effective use of the Colorado State Model Evaluation System. The Colorado State Model Performance Management System was available to use beginning with the 2014-2015 school year.
COPMS includes an electronic interface and data collection tools for the state model evaluation rubrics, measures of student learning/outcomes, final effectiveness ratings, and aggregate reports to support principals and district leaders in providing useful and actionable feedback and possible professional development opportunities for educators. For more information, [color=rgb(73, 78, 70)][highlight=transparent][url=https://www.cde.state.co.us/educatoreffectiveness/randafactsheet]please download our fact sheet (PDF)[/url][/highlight][/color] or contact [color=rgb(73, 78, 70)][highlight=transparent][url=mailto:educator_effectiveness@cde.state.co.us]Educator_Effectiveness@cde.state.co.us[/url][/highlight][/color].

step1.title: Introduction
step1.description: [highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)]Please complete this template to have us change anything in the CDE teacher evaluation system run by RANDA (aka COPMS--Colorado Performance Management System). This includes [/highlight][b][highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)][u]adding[/u][/highlight][/b][highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)] new staff that need to be in RANDA, [/highlight][b][highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)][u]changing[/u][/highlight][/b][highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)] roles of staff that are already in RANDA, and [/highlight][b][highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)][u]removing[/u][/highlight][/b][highlight=rgb(251, 249, 246)] staff from RANDA that are no longer at your school. This last one is very important because, if a teacher goes to another district, the teacher cannot be added to the new district's RANDA system until we have removed the teacher from ours. [/highlight]

step2.title: Instructions
step2.description:
Please fill in all [b][i][u]required[/u][/i][/b] fields.

Here are a few particulars about certain fields.
User means email address.
If your school does not know the EDID for the staff member, please submit an EDID request through Reportwell.
Status (of the Account) is either Active or Disabled.
[indent data=1]If you are adding an employee's role or changing one, please mark the Account as "Active."[/indent]
[indent data=1]If an employee is no longer a staff member of your school, please mark the Account as "Disabled."[/indent]
Please choose a role from the drop-down menu for Group To Add [b][u]or[/u][/b] Group To Remove and we will convert it into the matching RANDA code.

step3.title: Submittal timeframe
step3.description: This can be submitted at any time!
